alert.note: Alert for Clark (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 15 at 5:53AM CDT until July 15 at 7:15AM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 AM CDT THIS MORNING FOR NORTHWESTERN CLARK COUNTY... At 553 AM CDT, local law enforcement reported 3 to 4 inches of water over County Highway X and Copenhaver Avenue 5 miles west of Thorp. Between 2 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Thorp, Loyal, Greenwood, Reseburg, Sterling Avenue And Starks Road, Mead Lake, Highway 73 And 98, Eidsvold and Junction. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
